title: Andaman and Nicobar Islands Launch Island Trekking Festival at the Mount Harriet to Boost Eco-Adventure Tourism and Sustainable Travel Growth in India - Travel And Tour World
text:
The tropical paradise of Andaman and Nicobar Islands in India is all set to flag off the Island Trekking Festival on November 15, 2025, at Mount Harriet, the third-highest peak in the archipelago, showcasing its virgin nature’s beauty, eco-tourism initiatives, and establishing the islands as the ultimate eco-adventure tourist destination.
This festival will finally showcase the region’s rich biodiversity and offer tourists opportunities for trekking, wildlife watching, and nature conservation. The opening of this new festival is expected to attract domestic and international visitors in search of unique eco-tourism experiences while preserving the natural heritage in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. Advertisement Mount Harriet , located in the southern part of South Andaman , is one of the most significant trekking destinations in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands . The peak offers stunning panoramic views of the surrounding forests , mountains , and coastline , making it an ideal location for eco-adventure tourism activities. The Island Trekking Festival will provide a platform for travelers to explore the lush landscapes of the island while promoting sustainable travel practices .
The initiative aims to raise awareness about the importance of conservation and eco-tourism , which will help balance the growing interest in tourism with the need to preserve the region’s fragile ecosystems. Through activities like guided treks and wildlife exploration , visitors will connect with nature and learn about wildlife conservation efforts in the region. Collaborating with MY Bharat and the Ministry of Environment and Forests
The Island Trekking Festival is being organized by the Tourism Department of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands government , in collaboration with the Environment and Forests Department and MY Bharat , an online youth leadership and social engagement platform . This partnership brings together youth leaders , conservationists , and tourism operators to promote eco-tourism and engage the next generation of travelers in sustainable practices.
Through MY Bharat , young people can be more involved in tourism-related activities and contribute to eco-tourism initiatives that benefit both the environment and the local economy . By encouraging youth participation, the festival will also educate them on preserving the environment while enjoying the natural wonders of the islands. Advertisement The Andaman and Nicobar Islands have long been known for their natural beauty —from pristine beaches and coral reefs to dense forests and wildlife sanctuaries . However, the growth of tourism in recent years has placed increasing pressure on the islands’ ecosystems . The launch of the Island Trekking Festival is part of a broader eco-tourism strategy to promote sustainable tourism that preserves the environment and enhances the visitor experience.
By showcasing trekking and nature-based activities , the festival will not only draw tourists to the islands but also highlight the importance of responsible travel. As eco-tourism continues to rise in popularity, the Andaman and Nicobar Islands have the opportunity to position themselves as leaders in sustainable tourism , offering immersive travel experiences that connect visitors with nature while minimizing their environmental impact. Tourism’s Role in the Economic Growth of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands
Tourism is one of the most significant contributors to the local economy of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands , supporting local businesses , employment , and infrastructure development . By attracting eco-conscious travelers , the Island Trekking Festival will generate economic opportunities in the hospitality , transportation , and tourism sectors , creating jobs and boosting the economy in rural communities .
Through the development of eco-tourism products like the Island Trekking Festival , the Andaman and Nicobar Islands can achieve a sustainable tourism model that benefits both locals and tourists , ensuring that the islands’ unique natural resources are preserved for future generations. Social Media and Digital Storytelling: Amplifying the Andaman’s Appeal
The Island Trekking Festival will also leverage social media platforms to engage global audiences . Travel vloggers , content creators , and tourists who attend the festival will document their experiences, sharing them through social media and digital content . This user-generated content will amplify the Andaman and Nicobar Islands’ tourism appeal , attracting global tourists interested in eco-tourism and nature-based experiences .
Through the sharing of beautiful imagery and authentic travel stories , the festival will inspire travelers from around the world to consider the Andaman and Nicobar Islands as their next eco-friendly vacation destination . The growing interest in eco-adventure tourism means that the festival will play a key role in boosting tourism and encouraging travelers to explore responsible travel options. Future Prospects for Sustainable Tourism in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands
Looking ahead, the Island Trekking Festival is just one part of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands’ broader tourism strategy to position itself as a global eco-tourism hub . Future plans include expanding eco-tourism infrastructure , enhancing local conservation efforts , and developing new tourism products that attract responsible travelers interested in cultural heritage , wildlife conservation , and sustainable adventures .
As sustainable tourism becomes more mainstream, the Andaman and Nicobar Islands are well-positioned to capitalize on the global demand for eco-friendly travel experiences , offering visitors the chance to connect with nature in an authentic and sustainable way. The ongoing development of the islands’ tourism sector , coupled with a focus on environmental preservation , will ensure the long-term success of the region as an eco-tourism destination . Fostering Sustainable Tourism and Environmental Preservation in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands
The Island Trekking Festival in Andaman and Nicobar Islands is a major stride toward eco-tourism and responsible travel. With the emphasis on nature-based tourism, wildlife conservation, and cultural tourism, this festival will certainly enable these islands to secure their place among the leading destinations for eco-conscience travelers.
Thus, the Andaman and Nicobar Islands are to become the ultimate example of how tourism contributes to economic development with a focus on sustainability, cultural heritage, and the protection of the environment. As tourism grows, the islands will continuously set an example in terms of eco-tourism and responsible travel in ways that naturally preserve their natural resources and wildlife for posterity.
